line_1: Dick, You love Maps, and may perceive
line_2: Rome not far distant from Geneve.

line_1: Self-taught, when first the Velvet-Crabs perceive
line_2: Their loos'ning Shell will soon the Body leave,

line_1: When conseious they th' approaching Time perceive,
line_2: They fly the Deep, and wat'ry Pastures leave.
For faithless I can ne'er believe,

line_1: A Light, which in yourself you must perceive;
line_2: Jones and Le Nôtre have it not to give.

line_1: There, Madam, did you ne'er perceive
line_2: A Crowd of dwarfish Creatures live?

line_1: Where most he triumphs, we his wants perceive,
line_2: And for his weakness in his wisdom grieve.

line_1: Ought can exist, but what their Eyes perceive;
line_2: Unus'd to higher Truths will not believe

line_1: STREPHON is ill; and I perceive
line_2: His lov'd Elvira grows so grave,
